description: Here at Transformation Church we believe in Representing God to the lost and found for Transformation in Christ. We are a multi-ethnic, multi-generational, and multiplying church committed to progression not perfection. We are led by Lead Pastors Michael and Natalie Todd.

items.content:
In Week 1 of the Damaged but Not Destroyed Series, Pastor Mike challenges a common cultural belief that discourages honesty, suggesting that those who speak the truth might suffer harm. Drawing on the childhood saying, "Snitches get stitches," he encourages a different perspective. This message will cause you to reframe this idea, emphasizing that when we are honest and transparent about our shortcomings, it allows God to bring healing to the areas where we've fallen apart. He reminds us that God doesn't bless who we pretend to be but who we really are. We pray this message gives you the courage you need to honestly share where you are so that Jesus can come and make you whole.

Scripture References:
John 8:36 NIV
John 8:32 KJV
James 5:6 NLT
John 20:19-29 NLT
John 20:26 NLT
Hebrews 12:2 NIV
Isaiah 53:5 KJV
1 Timothy 1:15 NKJV

items.title: Snitches Get Stitches // Damaged But Not Destroyed (Part 1) // Michael Todd

items.content:
In Week 3 of the Kingdom Kouples Series, Pastor Mike delves into the sensitive topic of knowing when it's time to end partnerships. Using the journey of the Apostle Paul’s experience in navigating his partnerships with Silas and Barnabas, this story gives us valuable keys. Pastor Mike outlines several ways we can discern the departure of a partnership: when the season changes, we sense the same cycle persists, when storm is coming, or simply if Holy Spirit says go. If you are navigating your relationships, watch this sermon to gain insight and understand how Holy Spirit can partner with you in this season.


Scripture References:
Acts 15:36-40 NLT
Acts 15:37-38 NLT
2 Corinthians 11:23-28 NIV
Acts 16:16-40 NIV
John 16:13 NLT
Ephesians 2:10 NLT

items.title: The Departure Of Partnership // Kingdom Kouples (Part 3) // Michael Todd

items.content:
Embracing the power in the partnership can be a journey and we all need wisdom on how to pick the right partner. The pathway to powerful partnership is in the pick. In Week 2 of the Kingdom Kouples series, Pastor Mike shows us how Jesus picked his partners and showed us what to look for in a powerful partner. We pray you become a partner and find partners that master the art of the pump-up, principles and presence.Scripture References:
Ephesians 4:9-12 NLT
Luke 6:12-16 NLT
Ephesians 4:29 NLT
Ephesians 6:18 CSB
John 1:6-8 NIV

items.title: How to Pick a Partner // Kingdom Kouples (Part 2) // Michael Todd

items.content:
Are you ready to uncover the transformative Power of pairing with people in your life?

In Pastor Mike’s first sermon back from sabbatical, we dive into what it takes to have thriving relationships as we begin our new “Kingdom Kouples” series.

In this message, we address isolation's impact and the need to seek partners and friendships for purpose, ON purpose. We’re reminded the power lies not just in working together, but in PAIRING together. Your destiny is linked to your friendships.

As you tune in, discover the profound impact of right fit partnerships and the support they provide during life's falls.


Scripture References:Ecclesiastes 4:9-12 (NLT)
Ecclesiastes 4:9 (NLT)
James 1:14-16 (NLT)
Mark 6:6-7 (NLT)
Mark 6:8-13 (NLT)

items.content:
Could it be possible that we don’t always know when we are spiritually asleep? Pastor Robert Madu walked us through the story of Eutychus falling from a window during one of Apostle Paul's teachings. Not only does this story show us the danger of sitting near open windows (symbolizing exposure to sin), it shows us that we need people in our lives who will nudge us when we get weary. We pray that you have community in your life that can identify signs that you’ve become spiritually sleepy and that they help awaken you and reposition you to avoid falling into sin.

Scripture References
Acts 20:7-12 NIV
Acts 20:8 NIV
1 Thessalonians 5:5-6 NIV
Romans 13:11-12 NIV
1 Peter 5:8 NIV
Luke 9:32 NIV
Acts 20:10 NIV
Romans 13:11-12 NIV

items.title: From The Window To The Fall // Robert Madu

items.content:
Holy rebels are willing to take the risk of relationships. In the final week of the Holy Rebellion series, Pastor Charles reminded us of our need for community. While relationships come with beauty and brokenness, there is nothing like having friends who will pull you, protect you and pour into you. We are created with the purpose and the power to stand up and stand out for PEOPLE. We pray that this message sparks you to pray that God sends you the friends that align with your purpose.

If you’re looking for community, join an online or local Belong Group near you at: https://transformchurch.us/belong/

Scripture References
Romans 1:16 NKJV
Galatians 3:28 NIV
Genesis 2:18 NIV
Daniel 3:24-25 NIV
Daniel 3:16-18 NIV
John 15:15 NKJV
Ephesians 6:12 NIV
Proverbs 18:24 NKJV

items.title: I Refuse To Be Alone // Holy Rebellion: The Kingdom Is Here (Part 4) // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
In today’s culture, we have become obsessed with knowing our purpose. In Week 3 of the Holy Rebellion series, Pastor Charles challenges us with this question - What good is it to know your purpose if you don’t have power? We are not the source of our own power. Pastor Charles walks us through how to get our power from God by calling on Him, connecting with Him, and understanding the cost. We pray this message helps you connect or re-connect with the power of God so that you can walk confidently in your purpose.

Scripture References:
Job 12:4 NLT
Mark 16:15 NLT
Romans 1:16 NKJV
2 Timothy 3:1-5 AMP
Matthew 28:18-20 NLT
Acts 1:1-8 NLT

items.title: I Refuse To Be Powerless // Holy Rebellion: The Kingdom Is Here (Part 3) // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
In Week 2 of the Holy Rebellion Series, we delve into the essence of the Root of Rebellion. While the previous week ignited our drive to embrace our created purpose, the current week compels us to pause and introspect, posing a critical question: What is the root of our rebellion? This message equips us with insight on how to confront bitterness, through allowing Holy Spirit to highlight our own personal roots. As we navigate through our personal journey of Holy Rebellion, may this message empower us to refuse bitterness and choose to be a blessing.

Scripture References
Romans 1:16 NKJV
Isaiah 53:2 NKJV
Hebrews 12:14-17 NLT
Psalm 34:8 NIV
Philippians 2:12-16 MSG

items.title: The Root Of Rebellion: I Refuse To Be Bitter // Holy Rebeliion: The Kingdom Is Here (Part 2) // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
Pastor Charles kicks off Week 1 of the new sermon series, “Holy Rebellion: The Kingdom is Here” by reminding us that we were not made to be regular but to rebel against the status quo and what culture has dictated. Whether your first word was “no” or you decided that you wouldn’t follow the traumatic patterns of your childhood, we are all rebels. The enemy's biggest goal is to use SHAME to convince REBELS that they are REGULAR so they end up RETREATING.
Allow this message to ignite your faith, remove shame from your name and follow the greatest rebel we know, Jesus. You were created with the purpose & the power to stand up and stand out!

Scripture References
Romans 1:16 NKJV
1 Thessalonians 5:18 ESV
Proverbs 11:14 ESV

items.title: Shame Ain’t My Name // Holy Rebellion: The Kingdom Is Here (Part 1) // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
This message is for the Independent….You Need H.E.L.P!
Paster Brie Davis reminds us that everything in the kingdom is turned upside down and maturity in Christ means acknowledging our absolute need for God.
As you journey towards spiritual transformation, remember to root yourself in LOVE, not fear. Enter a new phase in your spiritual walk, equipped with four major keys:
Heal your headEncounter EmpowermentLean into LovePray for Purity.
We invite you to communion with us, asking God where he needs to purify your heart and motive, then create a silent space to hear his response.
May this message serve as a guiding light for the next steps in your transformational journey. Embrace the H.E.L.P. you need and continue growing in Christ!

Scripture References
ROMANS 7:15 NLT
JEREMIAH 17:9-10 NLT
ROMANS 7:15-17, 21-25 NIV
ROMANS 8:5-6 NLT
ROMANS 8:11 NLT
ROMANS 8:38-39 NLT
Psalm 121: 1 KJV

items.title: You Need H.E.L.P // H.O.T. Girl Summer (Part 4) // Brie Davis

items.content:
Have you ever felt like you were caught in the middle of a storm? There are painful moments, opportunities to be hurt, and outsiders who have an explanation for why you may be going through these hard times. Pastor Bianca Olthoff reminds us that we may not know the WHY, but we must trust the WHO. While in Acts 27-28, Paul experienced a snake while on the island of Malta but ends up healing those with the same hands he experienced. We pray this message helps you find the purpose in your pain.

Scripture References
Acts 27:20-26 NIV
Acts 27:35 NLT
Acts 28:1-8 NIV
Acts 28:9a NIV
Acts 28:8b NIV

items.title: Grit Don’t Quit // H.O.T. Girl Summer (Part 3) // Bianca Olthoff

items.content:
Have you ever made a bad decision that you had to deal with the consequences of? Have you ever made a mistake that you felt married to for the rest of your life? In Week 2 of our H.O.T. Girl Summer Series, Pastor Katy Kazadi did a masterful teaching on the story of David, Nabal and Abigail which resulted in “A Holy Divorce”. As you listen to this message of 1 Samuel 25, you will find how God can not only intervene before we make a detrimental decision but he can also help us divorce ourselves from past mistakes and failures and restore us.

Scripture References
1 Samuel 25:1-2 NLT
1 Samuel 25:3 NIV
1 Samuel 25:4-44 NLT
Revelations 12:10-11 NIV

items.content:
Dr. Jackie Greene kicks off our 1st Week of H.O.T. Girl Summer, a sermon series dedicated to bringing a month of Women speakers to share a Humble, Open, and Transparent message for all the family to hear! In this message, The Pain of First, we are reminded of all who came first in the Bible and how there are many things that God called us to be the first in, in our family. Oftentimes on the flipside of being first, there comes pain like being rejected, misunderstood and forming new habits. When we choose to embrace our assignment, recognize the pains that have hindered us, God will heal us and allow us to take our rightful place as FIRST.


Scripture References
Genesis 45:1-8 NLT
Romans 12:6-9 NLT
Deuteronomy 28:13 NLT
Genesis 37:3 NLT
Genesis 37:5-9 NLT
Psalm 84:11 NIV
Genesis 39:21 NLT
Genesis 50:20 NLT

items.content:
Join us this week as we wrap up the Worship on the Word series with a sermon titled "You Are Doing Good… AND". Pastor Charles teaches us that even amidst difficulties, we can acknowledge our growth and continue to aim for better.We're challenged to understand God in His complexity: relaxed AND righteous, simple AND sovereign, immediate AND infinite. Amid these revelations, we're encouraged to adopt a daily practice of gratitude, scripture reflection, and prayer.We pray that this sermon uplifts you, reminding you that you're doing good, AND there's still more to strive for in your spiritual journey.

items.content:
Worship is more than a practice; it's a weapon. This week Pastor Travis Greene helps us dive into the crucial role of worship and how a life dedicated to it shapes our character as part of our Worship On The Word series.Based on Psalms 34:1-8 and 1 Samuel 21:9-15, Pastor Travis emphasizes the importance of choosing the right sources of nourishment, physically and spiritually, as these determine the weapons we wield in life's battles. It reminds us that the truest affirmation of God’s trust in us comes from opposition, not opportunity, and our anointing is evident not in our skills, but in our scars. We pray this message helps you to be a "decided worshipper" steadfast in faith, regardless of your circumstances.

Scripture References
Psalms 34:1-8 ESV
Psalms 34:1 ESV
1 Samuel 21:9-15 MSG
Psalm 23:5 NIV
2 Kings 3:15 NKJV

items.content:
We all have access to the covering of the Most High God but we must accept being covered. Our protection comes from proximity to God. We need more than a scripture every Sunday or listening to our favorite Christian artist when times get hard. Pastor Mike teaches us that there is shelter under the Most High God. When we create a dedicated space to run to him, we will find safety and everything we need. We pray that after listening to this message you find a place to dwell with Him!

Scripture References
Malachi 3:6 KJV
Psalms 7:17 NASB
Psalms 97:9 NASB
Genesis 14:18-20 NASB
Psalms 91:1 ESV
John 14:6 NIV
Philippians 2:10-11 NKJV
Romans 5:12-21 NLT
Romans 6:1-4 NLT

items.content:
Have you ever been in a place of believing God for a miracle? Miracles do not have a formula, they simply require faith! In order to have faith, we must have hope. Because miracles start with hope, the enemy tries his best to discourage us in that area. We pray that this message builds your hope to fuel expectation and anticipation to have the mindset of a miracle.

Deuteronomy 29:29 ESV
Hebrews 11:1 KJV
Zechariah 9:12 KJV
Mark 16:17-18 NKJV
Matthew 17:20 NKJV
Mark 5:25-34 NLT

Mark 5:27 NLT
Mark 5:35-36 NLT

items.content:
This week, Pastor Mike presents a stirring message: "I WILL DO IT [HERE]" as part of our ongoing Worship on the Word series. Challenging the notion that worship is a remote act, he encourages us to recognize that our present moment, our [here] is Holy. We learn that obedience to God isn't conditional on our feelings; it's an unequivocal commitment to His will.

This sermon dissects the battle of the three wills—My Will, I Will, and His Will. He explains that our worship is expressed in our obedience and faithful walk towards God's purpose, even when we can't foresee the outcome. Furthermore, he challenges us to align our service with our worship, emphasizing that our acts of service must extend beyond our immediate circles. Join us in this transformative journey, as we learn to say "I WILL DO IT [HERE]," activating God's will in our lives.

items.title: I Will Do It [Here] // Worship On The Word (Part 3) // Michael Todd

items.content:
Can you worship God if your circumstances are not ideal? Many times we say “I won’t” if our job is stressful, our relationships aren’t how we want them to be, we are offended, or when we don’t understand what God is doing. It takes faith to believe in our situation or our God. In this message, Pastor Mike teaches us how to say, “I will when I don’t want to.” Worship is our Love EXPRESSED to God as a response to His grace towards us. We pray this message helps give you encouragement to bless the Lord at ALL times.

Scripture References
Isaiah 40:31 ESV
Proverbs 18:21 NKJV
2 Corinthians 5:18-20 NLT
Romans 5:8 NIV
Romans 12:1 NIV
Psalms 34:1-3 NKJV
Isaiah 29:13 NIV

items.content:
Worship is our love expressed to God as a response to His grace towards us. In the first week of our Worship on the Word series, Pastor Mike helps us understand that worship is more than a slow song; it’s about our hearts and how we live our life. As we worship, we may recognize that there are some holes in our hearts that have caused us to leak out the love that God has given us. Yet in His presence, He gives us a new heart so that we can operate out of the overflow of His love. This message helps us to understand why we worship, how it starts with love, and why we can run to worship in our vulnerability.

Proverbs 4:7 NKJV
Matthew 22:37-38 NLT
John 3:16 NIV
Deuteronomy 30:6 NLT
2 Corinthians 5:17 NLT
Philippians 1:9 NLT
Ephesians 6:16 NLT
2 Thessalonians 3: 3 NLT
Psalm 91:1-2 NLT
1 Corinthians 13:6-8 NIV
Psalms 119:9 NIV

items.content:
In Week 4 of the KingNUMB series, Pastor Brie shared a powerful message that caused us to examine our hearts. If you’ve ever felt disconnected from the presence of God, this message is for you! Sometimes the effect of our busyness, schedules, plans, grief, and loss can get in the way of being present with God’s presence. In this message, we take time to meditate on our blessings, brokenness, and what we have to give. We believe you will have the opportunity to ignite your faith and feel God burn within you again.

Scripture References:
Luke 24:13-34 NLT

items.title: Feel The Burn // KingNUMB (Part 4) // Brie Davis

items.content:
Pastor Tim Ross walks us through the story of the prodigal son. Sometimes being numb to your current reality can cause you to make decisions that are outside of God’s will. While the youngest son was outside of his father’s presence, he squandered his money and found himself working amongst pigs. Sin always takes you farther than you planned. In the midst of being in the pig stye, the youngest son came to his senses. In repentance, he ran back to his father’s house and was greeted with a party only to be met by a brother who was numb himself. What this message teaches us is that there can be 2 extremes of being numb - for some of us, we have sinned and can come back to our senses, for others we have to be careful to not allow our outward “perfection” to make us numb to our inward imperfections.

Scripture References:
Luke 15:11 - 32 NLT

While the youngest son was outside of his father’s presence, he squandered his money and found himself working amongst pigs. Sin always takes you farther than you planned. In the midst of being in the pig stye, the youngest son came to his senses. In repentance, he ran back to his father’s house and was greeted with a party only to be met by a brother who was numb himself. What this message teaches us is that there can be 2 extremes of being numb - for some of us, we have sinned and can come back to our senses, for others we have to be careful to not allow our outward “perfection” to make us numb to our inward imperfections.

Scripture References:
Luke 15:11 - 32 NLT

items.title: Numb One // KingNUMB (Part 3) // Tim Ross

items.content:
There are times in our walk with God when we can become numb and we lose the sensation and sensitivity of God in our hearts. There’s nothing good that comes from numbness; outside culture can influence your inside character, it’s hard to discern good from bad, and compromise can happen when you lose feeling.
Once we remove the noise and the gods we may have created, we will see that God has been speaking the entire time. Through the power of God and this message, we pray Holy Spirit highlights the areas of numbness and brings back your sensitivity.

Scripture References:
Amos 5:18-27 NLT
Isaiah 46:1-10 NLT

items.title: You Thought You Were Feeling Me??? // KingNUMB (Part 2) // Tim Ross

items.content:
Pastor Jerry Flowers kicked off the KingNUMB series with a message titled, “He Set it Straight”. We delved into the story of the woman with an infirmity for 18 years in Luke 13:10-17. Like the woman, the enemy wants us to keep looking down on our troubles and dirt so that we become numb to the power of the Gospel. As we continue to bring ourselves to Church and the community of Christ, Jesus sees us, calls us and looses us. Our worship, prayer and devotion set things straight in our life and our legacy.

Scripture References:
Luke 13:10-17 NKJV
Acts 5:28-29 NKJV
Luke 13:12 NKJV
Matthew 23:6 NKJV
1 John 1:6 NKJV
Ephesians 5:8 NKJV
John 8:12 NKJV
Matthew 21:14 NKJV
Luke 13:13 NKJV

items.title: He Set It Straight // KingNUMB (Part 1) // Jerry Flowers

items.content:
It’s week 4 of Easy Money, and we have our oversight pastor Tim Ross sharing a powerful word with us! In today’s message, Pastor Tim shows us what it means to be a multiplier in the Kingdom. We aren’t called to get money so we can hold onto it & hoard it for ourselves. We are called to get money so we can give it away. When we realize that God is trusting us to be a blessing to others, we can easily give away whatever He asks of us. We realize it’s not our own, and when we can give away what He has trusted us with, He multiplies it.

#easymoney #FinancialSeries #TransformationChurch #financialstewardship #timross

items.title: QUALIFIED TO MULTIPLY  // EASY MONEY (PART 4) // TIM ROSS

items.content:
In Week 3 of the Easy Money Series, Pastor Robert Morris addresses our heart motives as it pertains to kingdom finances. We discussed giving and how becoming a giver is becoming like God.Here are 4 steps we must take to become givers with pure hearts:
  1. Deal with a Selfish Heart
  2. Deal with a Grieving Heart
  3. Develop a Generous Heart
  4. Develop a Grateful Heart
As we grow in our understanding of generosity, may we understand that we don’t give to get but we GET to give!

Scripture References
Matthew 7:1-2 NKJV
Luke 6:37-38 NJKV
Deuteronomy 15:7-8 NKJV
Deuteronomy 15:9 NKJV
Deuteronomy 15:14 NKJV

items.title: IT’S ALL ABOUT THE HEART // EASY MONEY (PART 3) // ROBERT MORRIS

items.content:
Throughout the Bible, God highlights the importance of stewardship. As we learn about stewarding our finances, understand that God is after our money because He is after our hearts. Matthew 6:21 tells us, “Where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.”We learned last week that ‘Money Follows Mastery’ and in this sermon, we learn that ‘Money Requires Management’. If we want to see more money in our lives, we must value managing it well.Here’s 7 Secrets to Simple Stewardship:
  1. Seek First: Kingdom Thinking
  2. Sow Frequently: Trusting
  3. Spend Feasibly: Tracking
  4. Save Fundamentally: Timing
  5. Secure the Future: Transferring
  6. Savor Fully: Tasting
  7. Set Apart the Forbidden: Tithing
By the end of this message, our desire is to stop praying for money and ask God for wisdom on how to manage what we have right now and our mindset around it!

#EasyMoney #FinancialSeries #TransformationChurch #FinancialStewardship

Scripture References:
Proverbs 11:4 MSG
Matthew 6:21 NKJV
Matthew 25: 14-15 NLT
Proverbs 10:22 NLT
Matthew 6:33 NLT
Proverbs 9:10 NIV
2 Corinthians 9:10 NKJV
Luke 14:28-30 NLT
Genesis 41:25-32
Proverbs 13:22 ESV
Psalm 34:8 NLT
Malachi 3:8-12 NKJV
Leviticus 27:30 NKJV
Deuteronomy 26:1-2 NKJV
Luke 16:11-12 NIV

items.title: THE MI$-MANAGEMENT OF MILLION$: 7 $ECRET$ TO $IMPLE $TEWARD$HIP // EASY MONEY (PART 2) // MICHAEL TODD

items.content:
Welcome to Week 1 of the Easy Money Series! When it comes to lessons on finances, many people have heard about the Prosperity Gospel and the Poverty Gospel. However, we are introduced to the Purpose Gospel because all money in the kingdom has a purpose! Pastor Mike taught us that money follows mastery. Mastery only happens when you focus! This lesson encourages us to not just secure the bag but to secure our craft. We never have to follow money when we focus on the Master and our Mastery.
#easymoney #financialseries #transformationchurch #financialstewardship

Deuteronomy 28:12 NLT
Matthew 6:33 AMP
Proverbs 11:24-26 MSG

Colossians 3:23-24 NIV

items.title: MONEY FOLLOW$ MA$TERY // EASY MONEY (PART 1) // MICHAEL TODD

items.content:
There’s a difference between fashion and style. You can have the nicest clothes, but still not know how to put them together. The same thing works with what the Holy Spirit gives us. In week 5 of our new series KingDUMB, Pastor Mike teaches us how we can let the Holy Spirit tailor what was given to us in a way that is attractive to others and draws them to Jesus. Let this message empower you today!

#KingdomSeries #KingDUMB #tailor #style

items.title: Change Clothes: Style In The Kingdom // KingDUMB (Part 5) // Michael Todd

items.content:
Today, Pastor Mike taught us how to serve in the kingdom of God. We learned that oftentimes we want to do what feels good, but we don’t serve our feelings. We place our feelings sub to the mission of God. How do you know you’re serving the King? It’s typically the opposite of what you want to do. Jesus even had opportunities to power trip but he had a power flip and walked in righteousness instead. This message will teach you how to surrender your feelings and opinions in order to walk in your God-given dominion.
#KingDUMB #KingdomSeries #serving #serve

In this message, Pastor Mike reminded us that we are ‘Destined for Dominion’. From the beginning of time, dominion was crafted in our DNA and it’s our responsibility to walk in our royal power. God has ownership and we have rulership on Earth. We pray this message causes you to rise in your kingdom identity and sonship so that we can see heaven on Earth!Scripture References:

items.title: DESIGNED FOR DOMINION: Share The Kingdom Part 2 // KingDUMB (Part 3) // Michael Todd

items.content:
God’s plan from the beginning has always been partnership. We have the choice to simply walk in our identity as children of God or the authority of being an heir in the kingdom of God. In week 3 of our series KingDUMB, Pastor Mike illustrated what it means to seek the kingdom, be a partner and walk in our authority so that we can not only share the kingdom but claim your share of the kingdom.

#KingDUMB #KingdomSeries #partnership

items.title: IMMA PARTNER IN THIS THING: Share The Kingdom // KingDUMB (Part 3) // Michael Todd

items.content:
It's week 2 of our series KingDUMB! This week we learned the value of seeking the Kingdom and through a demonstration of ‘Hide and Seek’, we found out that it is NOT the same as looking. If you want the kingdom, God isn’t just going to give it to you, you have to search for it. The kingdom doesn’t come by proximity but by pursuit.

We pray that this message gives you an appetite to seek the kingdom because it’s the ONE thing you can pursue and receive EVERYTHING along with it.

#KingdomofGod #SeekTheKingdom #Seek1st #KingdomMessage #KingdomSermon

items.title: I Ain’t Gonna Give You What You Don’t Want: Seek The Kingdom // KingDUMB (Part 2) // Michael Todd

items.content: We kicked off the very first Kingdom Sermon Series entitled, I Will Not Be KingDUMB. Today, we learned that God’s people are destroyed for lack of knowledge, which translates in Hebrew, to ‘light’ (Hosea 4:6 KJV). When we walk without the light of God’s word, we walk in ignorance, also known as darkness in Hebrew.In this sermon we are taught how to SEE the Kingdom. The promise for this series is that our THINKING changes so that we can turn to God and see, seek, speak and serve the kingdom. If you’re ready for the Rise of a Holy Rebellion, stay tuned every Sunday at 10:45am CT.

Today, we learned that God’s people are destroyed for lack of knowledge, which translates in Hebrew, to ‘light’ (Hosea 4:6 KJV). When we walk without the light of God’s word, we walk in ignorance, also known as darkness in Hebrew.In this sermon we are taught how to SEE the Kingdom. The promise for this series is that our THINKING changes so that we can turn to God and see, seek, speak and serve the kingdom. If you’re ready for the Rise of a Holy Rebellion, stay tuned every Sunday at 10:45am CT.

items.content:
Today we received a collision with vision as Pastor Mike shared the importance of having vision in his first message of 2023. The most valuable thing we can have is vision because it is the key to our future. It gives us the ability to see what is INVISIBLE and make it POSSIBLE. Though your vision may seem out of reach, it is not out of sight. Pastor Mike shares what has come to pass over the course of his life as a result of valuing vision and he also reveals the word of the year for 2023!We believe that this is the year of Kingdom: The Rise of a Holy Rebellion.Watch this video for a life-changing word that will truly change how you see the rest of your life.

#WordofTheYear #VisionSunday2023 #Kingdom #TheRiseofAHolyRebellion

items.content: In this message, Pastor Charles explores the deeper meaning of prayer and explains that Prayer can be a portal to paradise. Prayer isn't just about communication with God but rather it is about communion with Him. We learn that fasting can help us grasp the importance of denying our flesh to be in close proximity with God. If you have struggled with understanding the purpose and power of prayer and fasting, this message is for you!

items.content:
We often think obedience is successful when we see the outcome. But it’s really successful when we give it. It’s not about us receiving. It’s about doing what God has told us to do, when He told us to do it. Today, Pastor Mike shows us that we are not controlling the clock. He teaches us that we won’t have forever to do what God has called us to do. Our obedience matters, and He’s calling us to obey today! If you’re someone who has been battling with obedience, this message is for you!

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToTheClock #obedience

items.content:
Culture tells us that life is about climbing. If we don’t think we’re good enough in an area, we tell ourselves we have to work and strive to gain a higher position and improve our status. But kingdom culture teaches the opposite. In part 16 of Cuffing Season, Pastor Charles teaches us how we can recognize climbing in our lives. We learn that we can stop trying to reach the top & receive righteousness where we are. Make sure you share this message with a friend!

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToClimbing #climbing

items.content:
We’re so used to cap. We’re used to lying.The currency of today’s culture is cap, making us think it’s profitable to lie and appear as something we’re not. But what we are trying to avoid by lying will cost us in the long run. In week 15 of Cuffing Season, Pastor Mike teaches us how becoming comfortable with cap desensitizes us to the presence of Christ. He shows us how we can recognize cap in our lives, and break the habit of lying. We have to remember that God can handle the truth.

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToCap #lying

items.content: We’ve all cuddled with someone who is comfortable & convenient. We’ve looked for love, validation, & acceptance, but we’ve settled for the cuddle that’s a cheap copy. When we make these counterfeit connections, we compromise. In week 14 of Cuffing Season, Pastor Mike shows us how to recognize when we’ve settled, and the steps we can take to find God’s best for our relationships. Ask yourself this today: Who are you cuddling with?

items.content: What are you building? God never called you to build your own platform, His desire is to build his platform in you for Him to stand on. This week, Travis Greene asks the question, what bricks are we using? We have built our platforms with bricks that are self-made, of acceptance, fame, dishonor, and jealousy. God wants to break down the bricks of our own creation and build his Kingdom with stones. If you want to allow God to build His platform in you, this message is for you!

items.content:
What controls you: money or God? Your answer to that question reveals what you're cuffed to. This week, Pastor Mike teaches us how cash is important to life, but it cannot be the center of it. The only thing that can provide us with a truly fulfilling life is Jesus, and finances are always something He calls us to use to build His Kingdom. Our money will always have control until we can give it. If you’re looking for some help with your money, this message is for you!

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToCash #cash #finances

items.content: What is surrounding you? What kind of people are you letting influence your life? We will always become like the things we surround ourselves with, and when we get around people and things that aren’t good for us, we become cuffed to things that contaminate us. In week 11 of our series Cuffing Season, Pastor Mike teaches us how to get free from the things that have contaminated us and step into God’s calling for our lives.

items.content:
Cuffing Season is back! In this series, God has been revealing that we are all cuffed to something in life. The question is are you going to stay cuffed, or find freedom in Jesus? This week, we learn all about the dangers of cocky Christianity. God has promises for us. But we often can’t step into those promises because we won’t give up control. Pastor Mike teaches us that we are never fully in control, and we can only find true peace when we give it up for God’s plan. We can never be cuffed and in control. If you’re wondering how to give God more control in your life, this message is for you!

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToControl #control

items.content:
We’re all born into a story that’s already taking place. And our innate desire is to find out what character or role we are supposed to play in that story. We all know we have a place, and we’re constantly looking for it. But we have to look in the right place. Today, Pastor Brie & Aaron Davis teach us how important it is for us to find love, and that the only love that can truly satisfy us comes from God.

#marriage #shame #story

items.content:
God is not just the god of beginnings. He’s also the God of endings. He lets us go through things, and sometimes, He never explains why. Lead pastor of Change Church Dr. Dharius Daniels brought us a powerful message on how we can exit situations the Godly way. Even when we don’t know why God is taking us through something, we can rest in knowing that it was for our good and His glory. If you’re wondering what to do in a season of transition, this message is for you!

#DhariusDaniels #IDontNeedClosure #exits

items.content:
At Transformation Church, we believe that there are three baptisms: baptism into salvation, baptism in water, and baptism in the Holy Spirit. Flood Sunday is all about baptism in water. It’s an outward sign of an inward decision. Many of us stop the flow after salvation. But today, Pastor Mike taught us that baptism isn’t an obligation. It’s an opportunity for overflow! We challenge you to not stop the overflow. It’s Different Now.

#FloodSunday #baptism #overflow

items.content:
It’s Homecoming Sunday at Transformation Church! After over 900 days, we have finally opened our doors again! We were so excited to see our TC family, and Pastor Mike brought a powerful word. He taught us what home is supposed to look like through God’s eyes, and what happens when we run away from it. When we get far from home, we get far away from the Father. But no matter how far we are, God always welcomes us back with open arms. It’s time to come home!

#Homecoming #TCIsBack #TCHomecoming #REpresent

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us, or text ‘SHARE’ to 828282 for more info.

If you would like to support TC financially you can give through the TC app, or online through our website by clicking here https://transformchurch.us/give/. Text ‘GIVE’ to 828282 to give using your mobile device.

If you need prayer, email prayer@transformchurch.us!

For more information about Transformation Church, visit transformchurch.us or follow us on our social media platforms below.

Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/wearetransformation/
Facebook- https://www.facebook.com/wearetransformation/

items.content: Week 4 of our series Launch In Victory started with a bang! Our lead pastor, Michael Todd, is back, and he’s teaching us everything we need to launch something in all of our lives. What is God wanting to launch in your life? Take that step. Start that project. Write that song. If God is calling you to it, He will help you through it. Let this series be a launching pad for whatever God is starting in your life. Let us know what God is launching in your life, and share this message with a friend!

items.content:
If we’re not careful, we can make our Christian walk about what we can give to God. But the story of the Gospel doesn’t start with what we have given God. It starts with what God has given us: people. In week 3 of Launching In Victory, Pastor Charles teaches us how the people in our lives are gifts. He meant for us to fulfill our purpose together! If you’re looking to find purpose, this message is for you! Make sure to share with a friend!

#LaunchInVictory #GodsGreatestGift #CharlesMetcalf

items.content:
Have you ever been under pressure? Surely you’ve faced a situation where success or failure was up to you. How did you perform? Did you rise to the occasion, or did you falter under the weight of what was going on? How can we even hope to succeed in high-pressure situations? All it takes is one word: Practice. In week 2 of our series Launching In Victory, Pastor Charles teaches us the importance of practice and how it prepares us for our purpose. If you’re looking to grow in your purpose, this message is for you! Make sure you share it with a friend!

#LaunchInVictory #PracticeMakesPerfect #CharlesMetcalf

items.content:
We all have felt a pull to start something new. Change a job. Write a song. Go out with that person. So why can it be so hard to start? In our new series Launch In Victory, Pastor Charles Metcalf reveals to us how our lack of safety can hinder our start. He teaches us that when we find safety in prayer with God, we can do more than we’ve ever imagined. If you’re looking for that push to start, this message is for you!

#LaunchInVictory #ASafePlaceToStart #CharlesMetcalf

items.title: Here Feels _______, Here Is Holy // What I’m Hearing Here (Part 4) // 7N7

items.content:
What do you do when you can’t hear God? What happens when we reach out to Him, and He’s silent? Sometimes we can be in a season where we’re asking God for answers, and we hear nothing back. Many of us see God's silence as a punishment. But maybe it's actually a sign of intimacy. In week 3 of our series What I’m Hearing Here, executive pastor Amberly Bell shares with us that when God is silent, He’s never absent. If you're trying to hear from God, this message is for you. Check it out and share it with someone in your life who needs to hear it!

#WhatImHearingHere #HereIsHoly #TheSilentSetup #AmberlyBell

Join us for service every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Tell us your story by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

If you would like to support TC financially you can give through the TC app, or online through our website by clicking here https://transformchurch.us/give/. You can also Text ‘TCGIVE’ to 77977.

If you need prayer, email prayer@transformchurch.us!

For more information about Transformation Church, visit transformchurch.us.

items.title: The Silent Setup // What I’m Hearing Here (Part 3) // Amberly Bell

items.content:
With all the noise in today’s world from notifications, calendar reminders, ringtones, music, TV shows, movies, podcasts, and more, it’s very difficult to find a quiet place. But when the world around you is loud, how loud is is your internal noise? What is the soundtrack of your soul? In week 2 of our series What I’m Hearing Here, our chief of staff Brie Davis brings a powerful message on how we can quiet what’s going on in our hearts and minds, and learn to hear and trust God. If this message has been encouraging for you, make sure to let us know & share it with a friend!

#WhatImHearingHere #HereIsHoly #BeQuietAndListen #BrieDavis

Welcome to our new series What I’m Hearing Here, a companion series to Here Is Holy. In this series, some of our staff & executive team share what God is speaking to them HERE, and challenge us to listen to what God is saying HERE.
In week one, Pastor Charles teaches us the power of what we listen to, how it can impact where we’re going, and how we can use it to reframe the way we think about Jesus. If this message has been encouraging for you, let us know & share it with a friend!

For week 4 of Fun Month, we’re joined by lead pastor of Embassy City Church in Irving, TX, Pastor Tim Ross. In this message, Pastor Tim shows us that although Jesus is the only One who brings us from death to life, each of us also has a part to play in helping others find freedom and healing. If this message has been encouraging for you, make sure to let us know & share it with a friend!

items.content:
For week 3 of Fun Month, we’re joined by special guest Alex Himaya, Senior Pastor of BattleCreek Church in Tulsa, OK. Don’t miss this message as Pastor Alex reminds us as Christians we should never get caught up in going through the motions and become stagnant, because if we do it will just make us tired, and eventually become “the walking dead.” We should instead wake up and turn to Christ, because He has covered our sins with grace!
If this message has encouraged you, make sure to let us know & share it with a friend!

items.content:
For week 2 of Fun Month, we’re joined by special guest Jabin Chavez, lead pastor of City Light Church in Las Vegas, NV. After five years of traveling the world and sharing the Gospel, Jabin and his wife Shanen moved from Newport Beach, CA to plant a life-giving church in the heart of the city in 2017. Don’t miss this message as Pastor Jabin reminds us that when we submit our plans and problems to God, it creates space for Him to show up in our situation. God wants our “yes”!
If this message has encouraged you, make sure to let us know & share it with a friend!

#FunMonthAtTC #FunMonth #JabinChavez #OneLife #fun

items.content:
Go, go, go! Hustle. Push. Work. That’s what this world teaches us. You can’t rest until you’ve put in the time. But what if that’s not kingdom culture. In week 9 of Cuffing Season, Pastor Mike teaches us about the gift of rest and how it can unlock the blessings of God in our lives. If this message blessed you, let us know in the comments and send it to a friend.

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToConstant #rest #sabbath

items.content: In between your crisis and your creator is your crowd. Will you let the crowd cripple your calling? Or will you push through the crowd, walk in your calling, and make contact with your creator. In week 8 of Cuffing Season, special guest Jimmy Rollins brings a powerful message teaching us the ways to ignore the crowd to get to our calling. If this message is encouraging to you, let us know & share it with a friend!

items.content:
This is a deliverance series, and the results should be the fruit of the Spirit. We see that fruit through discipline in our lives, and others should be able to see those results as well. But what do we do when they start talking about that fruit? In week 7 of Cuffing Season, Pastor Mike teaches us how to deal with the comments of those people who are critical of our calling.

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToTheComments #discipline #comments #Nehemiah

items.content:
When we give ourselves over to a cultural concept of how to eat, and not to the kingdom concept of honoring our bodies, we begin to live in gluttony. We are trying to satisfy an emotional need with a physical, tangible taste. Today, Pastor Mike helps us recognize gluttony in our lives, and how we can overcome it to honor God with our bodies. If this message was encouraging to you, let us know & share it with a friend!

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToCake #gluttony #cake

items.content:
Comfort. Convenience. Comparison. Those aren’t things we want to be attached to, and yet we find ourselves drawn to them daily. The enemy uses them to keep us in condemnation. But God wants to convict our hearts, and lead us back to Him. In week 5 of Cuffing Season, Pastor Mike brings a word on where condemnation comes from, and how we can step into the grace of God that is given to us. If this message was for you, let us know in the comments & send it to a friend!

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToCondemnation #condemnation #conviction

items.title: Cuffed To Condemnation // Cuffing Season (Part 5) // Michael Todd

items.content:
Comparison is a normal, human occurrence. It’s hard not to notice when someone has a nicer car than you, a bigger house than you, or seems more successful than you. We have all fallen into that temptation. But we can’t let comparison trap us. When it does, we begin to live outside of our calling and the life God has for us. In week 4 of our series Cuffing Season, Pastor Mike warns us about the dangers of comparison and teaches us how to kill it in our lives. If you know someone who needs this message, share the link with them!

#CuffingSeason #comparison #comparing #prodigalson

items.content:
In week three of Cuffing Season, we learn that this is a series of alignment. If you want what God has aligned for you, you may have to give up convenience. This week, Pastor Mike brings a life changing message on how catering to convenience has consequences, so we have to live comfortably uncomfortable in Christ. Make sure you share this message with someone this week!

#CuffingSeason #CuffedtoConvenience

items.content:
Deliverance is God’s desire for our lives, but it has to be our decision. He won’t make us choose to follow His calling. Do you want what God has for you? You may have to get uncomfortable. This week, Pastor Mike brought an incredible message on how we must leave our comforts and conveniences behind to get God’s best. Make sure you share this message with someone today!

#CuffingSeason #CuffedToComfort #David #Comfort

items.content:
In week one of our new series, Cuffing Season, Pastor Mike asks us “what are you cuffed to?” We’ve all tried to love things that don’t love us back. In this series, God is going to expose what we are cuffed to knowingly or unknowingly, and show us how we can be cuffed to Christ! Check out this message and share it with a friend!

#CuffingSeason #Samson #ThingsYouLove

items.content:
God won’t look us over for medals, degrees, or diplomas. He’ll look for our scars. Scars are proof that we were faithful in the good and bad times. This week, guest speaker Pastor Mike Jr., lead pastor of Rock City Birmingham, shared a powerful message with us about finding purpose in God, even in pain. Check out this message and share it with a friend!

#HereToRemindYou #Scars #MikeJr #RockCityChurch

items.content:
What is a garden? This Easter, Pastor Mike shared a message on the redemptive power of Jesus. Mankind was given a safe haven, a place of solitude, a garden. But we couldn’t protect it as we should, and there was only one way for it to be restored: through the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ. Check out this incredible Easter Sunday message and share it with someone who needs it!

#TheGarden #Easter #ResurrectionSunday #EasterAtTC

items.content: Is hell a real place? And if it is, why would a loving God send people there? Hell is a tough topic, but it’s something Jesus talked about, which means it’s something we should pay attention to. This week, lead pastor of Life.Church Craig Groeschel shares with why hell exists and how to save others from it.

items.content:
We all want control in life. We want to believe we’re in charge of what’s going on. But the truth is that the world is out of control. But we know the one who’s in control, and we can choose to see life’s situations like he does. In week 4 of our series Mo’ Money, Mo’ Problems, Pastor Charles Metcalf teaches us how giving can help us take our view off of ourselves and see the world as God does.

#MoMoneyMoProblems #ImLivingLarge #finances #generosity #CharlesMetcalf

items.content:
In the third week of our series Mo’ Money Mo’ Problems, we had the incredible opportunity to hear from Pastor Robert Morris of Gateway Church in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas. His practical example on the importance of tithing made for a powerful message. We learned that tithing is a test, it’s biblical and it’s personal! If you’re looking for wisdom and insight on tithing, this is the message for you.

#MoMoneyMoProblems #finances #tithing #generosity #RobertMorris

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us, or text ‘SHARE’ to 828282 for more info.

If you would like to support TC financially you can give through the TC app, or online through our website by clicking here https://transformchurch.us/give/. Text ‘GIVE’ to 828282 to give using your mobile device.

If you need prayer, email prayer@transformchurch.us!

For more information about Transformation Church, visit transformchurch.us or follow us on our social media platforms below.

Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/wearetransformation/
Facebook- https://www.facebook.com/wearetransformation/

items.title: Show Me The MOtive // Mo’ Money, Mo’ Problems (Part 2) // Michael Todd

items.content:
When it comes to money, people often have two mindsets: poverty or prosperity. But what if there was another? God wants to give us His mindset when we think about our finances. He doesn’t have a problem with paper. He’s just has a purpose for it. Pastor Mike teaches us how we can have that mindset of God. He shows us that money is not the answer to our problems, but God is.

#MoMoneyMoProblems #MoMoneyMoPurpose #generosity #purpose

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: Mo’ Money, Mo’ Purpose // Mo’ Money, Mo’ Problems (Part 1) // Michael Todd

items.content:
God wants to take us from HERE to THERE. But we can’t do that if we fight to stay HERE. We don’t need to fight God this year. If God said it… here we go! Pastor Mike shows us how we can equip ourselves for our assignment HERE, and prepare ourselves for THERE.

#HereIsHoly #HereWeGo #Obedience #HereToThere

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: Here We Go // Here Is Holy (Part 6) // Michael Todd

items.content:
Most people read the word of God through the lens of legalism instead of through the lens of love. They see boundaries as a negative. But boundaries are set for greater purpose and protection. If we’re given a boundary, it means we are loved. Pastor Mike shares with us how intentional limitation can elevate and enhance our relationship with God.

#HereIsHoly #NoLimits #Boundaries #IntentionalLimitation

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: kNOw Limits // Here Is Holy (Part 5) // Michael Todd

items.content:
How did we get here? What led us to where we are today? Life can be exhausting, and we’ve all been through things. But we only get here if God was faithful back there. Pastor Mike teaches us how we can look back on God’s faithfulness there to encourage us to be faithful here.

#HereIsHoly #ImStillHere #Faithful

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: I’m Still Here // Here Is Holy (Part 4) // Michael Todd

items.content:
God doesn’t bless who or where we pretend to be. He blesses who and where we really are. When we acknowledge where we are honestly, the natural suddenly becomes supernatural. The ordinary becomes extraordinary. Here becomes holy. Join Pastor Mike as he shows us how to take an assessment of where we are and how God moves in that honesty.

#HereIsHoly #ImStillHere #Honesty

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: I Feel God HERE: Spontaneous Worship Flow // Here Is Holy (Part 2) // Michael Todd

items.content:
We all have wanted to get “there”. We’ve all wanted to escape our present circumstances and move on to what we think is better. But what if “here” is right where God wants us to be? In our new series Here Is Holy, Pastor Mike shows us how to ignore “there”, and focus on the here and now.

#HereIsHoly #HereIAm #HowDidIGetHere #

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: Clearly // The Vision For Invasion // Vision Sunday 2022 // Michael Todd

items.content:
There’s a war inside of all of us. There are two forces constantly battling each other: our flesh and our spirit. This is the fight for true freedom in our lives. How do we win this war? Pastor Charles teaches us three things we can do to be victorious in this fight.

#WinTheWarWithin #HowToWinTheWar #prayer #fasting #BattleWithin

items.title: Win The War Within // How Do I Win The War? // The Sauce (Part 2) // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
Dessert is always good to you, but it’s not always good for you. It isn’t food, it’s pleasure. What kind of dessert are you holding onto? Gossip? Lust? Pride? When God wants to develop us, He doesn’t give us dessert. He takes us to the desert. In the first week of our series The Sauce, Pastor Charles shows us how to evaluate what we’re trying to take into the desert.

#DessertInTheDesert #TheSauce #Prayer #Development

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

If you would like to support TC financially you can give through the TC app, or online through our website by clicking here https://transformchurch.us/give/. Text ‘GIVE’ to 828282 to give using your mobile device.

If you need prayer, email prayer@transformchurch.us!

For more information about Transformation Church, visit transformchurch.us or follow us on our social media platforms below.

Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/wearetransformation/?hl=en
Facebook- https://www.facebook.com/wearetransformation/

items.title: Dessert In The Desert // You Can't Take That To The Desert // The Sauce (Part 1) // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
While Mary was given the responsibility of carrying Jesus, Joseph was given the responsibility of naming him. He called him Immanuel, God with us. He knew the power that was in a name. What are you naming the situations in your life? What are you giving power to with your words? Pastor Charles teaches how we can use our words to create God’s vision.

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

items.title: What Will You Name It? // Name It Before You Know It // Crazyer Faith (Part 13) // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
Even when God is faithful, things are not always perfect. We may face seasons of hardship, loss, or loneliness. Will we still be faithful? Will we believe God has our best, even if we’re fractured? Pastor Mike shows us that these seasons can be a part of God’s process. We can find provision, even in a fractured state.

#FracturedFaith #AreYouFrustrated #Fractured #Joseph

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

items.title: Fractured Faith // Will You Still Be Faithful? // Crazyer Faith (Part 12) // Michael Todd

items.content:
God calls us to believe, but not just for our own lives. We can get the car, the house, the job, but it means nothing if we don’t leave a legacy with our words and actions. Our lives will be defined not by what we gain, but by what we give away. Pastor Mike shows us that having Crazy Faith isn’t only about ourselves, and shows us how to live out a legacy that will last.

#LegacyOfFaith #FaithMove #Generations #Eternity

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: The Biggest Faith Move You Could Ever Make // Legacy Of Faith // Crazyer Faith (Part 11) // Michael Todd

items.content:
Our words have power. They can build us up or tear us down. What we say impacts what we see, so let’s see the impossible. Pastor Mike shows us how we can take back our words and begin to imagine a life beyond our belief.

items.title: Faith Talk // I Said What I Said // Crazyer Faith (Part 10) // Michael Todd

items.content:
The way we partner with God is through our faith. But what level is your faith at? From receiving salvation to believing for the impossible, our faith has levels. And we can access these higher levels if we find them in Christ. Dr. Dharius Daniels shows us which level we’re at, and how we can go higher.

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

items.title: There’s Levels To This // What Level Are You On? // Crazyer Faith (Part 9) // Dharius Daniels

items.content:
God has a blessing waiting for us on the other side of our faith. But what happens when we get it? Will it distract us from God’s calling, or will it be proof that God will do what He says He will do? Pastor Mike reveals to us how we can stay humble when God begins to fulfill His promises in our lives. Watch this message, and share it with a friend!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: Bamboozled By The Blessing // What Happens When You Get Your Blessing? // Crazyer Faith (Part 8) // Michael Todd

items.content:
God has a system for our seeds to grow: seed, sow, time, work, harvest. But different seeds grow in different ways. God is sovereign. He exists out of time, and can accelerate the system. Pastor Mike teaches about activating unusual acceleration. Don’t miss this word for your life, and make sure you share it with a friend!


Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: Faith Like A Farmer // Sow It Before You See It // Crazyer Faith // Michael Todd

items.content:
God has a vision for all of our lives. But are we preparing for it? When we take what God has given to us and write it down, we begin to fulfill that vision. If we’re vacant in preparation for it, it will pass us by. Pastor Mike shows us how we can get ready for God’s vision, and how we can begin to see our anointed imagination become reality.

#VacantVision

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: Vacant Vision // See It Before You See It // Crazyer Faith // Michael Todd

items.content:
Our faith can flourish, but only when it’s in the right atmosphere. We need people who will pray for us and speak the Word of God over our lives. Otherwise, we won’t be able to walk into the future God has for us. Pastor Mike shows us how we can identify those around us who will fight for our faith, even when we don’t believe. Listen to this message and share if with a friend today!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: The Circle Of Faith // Who’s Surrounding You? // Crazyer Faith // Michael Todd

items.content:
Is what you’re believing for faith? Or is it just fantasy? When we believe for something, we must make sure it’s in God’s will. Pastor Michael helps us determine if what we're believing for is from God or from our own thoughts. Listen to this sermon and share it with someone in your own life who needs to be impacted by the power of this message!

items.content:
Crazy Faith is not where we start. It begins with our imagination. It’s where we find ourselves after we’re diligent & dedicated to exercising baby faith. And when we stand in baby faith, God begins to take us beyond our belief. Listen this sermon and share it with someone in your own life who needs to be impacted by the power of this message!

In the second week of our series, Help I’m Hurting, we heard a powerful message from our very own Pastor Charles Metcalf. Have you ever felt hurt and hidden? Have you ever felt like the pain of your situation is almost as bad as being alone and not having anyone to share it with? If you feel like you are hidden, this message is for you. items.content:
This week, we had the honor of hearing from our very own Pastor Brie Davis! It was a special Sunday because it was the first week of our new series, Help, I’m Hurting. Pastor Brie taught us about the power of pain and how we are truly healed. All of us are facing pain, but the encouraging truth is that pain is a meeting place with God! Check out this message and share it with someone in your life who needs to hear it!

items.title: Help I’m Hurting // Are You In Pain? // Help, I’m Hurting // Brie Davis

items.content:
Welcome to our summer series, FUN MONTH! This week we have a special guest, Pastor Bianca Olthoff! Pastor Bianca and her husband Matt are lead pastors of “The Father’s House” in Orange County, California. They have been a part of the local church for over 20 years and have traveled the world teaching the gospel. They live in Orange Country with their two children, Parker and Ryen. Pastor Bianca is also the leader of “In The Name of Love” which is a non-profit organization dedicated to transforming lives through the saving power of Jesus Christ. Today she shared with us the difference between happiness and joy. Do you feel like you have been robbed this year emotionally and you want to get your joy back? Check out this message and share it with someone in your life who needs to hear it!


Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

items.content:
Join us for our summer series, FUN MONTH! This week we have a special guest, Robert Madu! He has traveled the globe for 20 years sharing the gospel of Jesus! Pastor Robert is from Dallas, Texas and is the lead pastor of Social Dallas with his wife, Taylor. Their family has found a place in the heart of Dallas to be a hub of hope, joy and life! Check out this message as Pastor Robert goes through how your vision affects your village and how to restore blurred vision by using biblical principles.

items.title: I’ve Seen This Before // Have You Checked Your Vision? // Fun Month // Robert Madu

items.content:
Have you ever heard someone say, “I am just living the dream”? In the fourth week of our series, The Paradox of Purpose we learned about the dreams that Joseph had and the impact those dreams had on his life. It wasn’t what he expected and some of the people he thought would be there for him weren’t, but Pastor Charles taught us that as long as you are faithful; favor will follow you! Make sure and check out this message and share it with someone who needs to hear it!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: Living The Dream // Is It What You Expected? // The Paradox of Purpose // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
In the third week of our new series, The Paradox of Purpose we learned that we often blame the devil for things that we should take ownership of. Pastor Charles taught us about deferred responsibility which is the act of placing ownership of one's attitude, circumstance or life on another person. It’s not always the devil, sometimes we are distracted, emotional, vulnerable, irresponsible or lazy. Make sure and check out this message and share it with someone who needs to hear it!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

items.title: Capital C Sunday // Change Starts in The Church // Devastation 2 Restoration

items.content:
In the second week of our new series, The Paradox of Purpose we were encouraged to answer when God calls us. It is not IF God calls you, but WHEN and if you will ANSWER. Your participation in God’s Purpose is a choice. Will you answer when God calls you? If you have ever questioned what your purpose is or if you are confused about your calling, this message is for you. Be encouraged that you don’t have to find calling, calling will find YOU!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

items.title: Answer The Call // Is God Calling You? // The Paradox of Purpose // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
In the first week of our new series, The Paradox of Purpose we were posed with the question; “What is my purpose?” Pastor Charles spoke so powerfully about the difference between Purpose and Calling. If you have ever asked questions like, “Why am I here,” “What’s next,” and “What is my purpose,” this message is for you. Remember, God doesn’t want you to do things for Him, He just wants you to BE with Him.

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

items.content:
On Flood Sunday, we learned that It’s Different Now. Today, over 25,000 individuals chose to take the next step into water baptism. Baptism is the outward sign of an inward decision. Baptism is the divine interruption. There is a journey after your salvation. It’s Different Now.

items.title: Flood Sunday // It’s Different Now // Michael Todd

items.content:
In Week 5 of our series The Upgrade, we learned about The Language of Heaven; Speaking in Tongues. Speaking in tongues should be a desire and not a demand. God never meant for tongues to be a burden, he meant for it to be a blessing. Today we learned that every believer can speak to the Holy Spirit, Are you ready to be built up?

In Week 4 of our series The Upgrade, we learned about the gifts of the Holy Spirit. The gifts of the Holy Spirit are not evidence, they are BENEFITS! There are four different categories of gifts; The Motivational Gifts, The Manifestation Gifts, The Ministry Gifts and The Ministerial Gifts. During this message, Pastor Michael unwrapped The Manifestation Gifts which are Discerning, Declarative and Dynamic. To learn more about the benefits of the Holy Spirit, watch this message now and don’t forget to share it with your friends and family!

items.title: I Have The Advantage // Who Is Your Comforter? // The Upgrade // Michael Todd

items.content:
Today we started our brand new series, The Upgrade. We were posed with the question, Why wouldn’t you accept the Upgrade? The Holy Spirit is not just a power, He is not just a Presence; The Holy Spirit is a PERSON and He wants a specific relationship with you. If you are wanting to know the unique position of The Holy Spirit in your life, this message is for you! Watch this sermon and share it with someone in your own life who needs to be impacted by the power of this message!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.content:
On Resurrection Sunday, we heard such an impactful message about the stains we have in our lives. Pastor Michael presented such a powerful illustration about how the things we experience in our life can stain us. But, the good news is that God came to exchange our stains for a new life with Him! Check out this incredible Easter Sunday message and share it with someone who needs it!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

items.title: Time To Grow Up // Are You Ready For The Next Level? // Paper Chasers // Charles Metcalf

items.content:
In the fourth week of our series Paper Chasers, we heard a powerful message entitled “First AIN’T Second!” We learned that the Principle of Tithing is only for people who consider God first in their lives. Pastor Michael showed us a practical example of the First Fruits that revealed to us how much God blesses us when we truly put Him first. Is God first in your life? Check out this message and share it with a friend!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

22:45 - Maturity = SACRIFICE
23:03 - What You Are WIlling to Part With Proves What You Are Willing to be Apart of!
24:23 - The Elsa Equation
24:53 - Maturity is NOT About What You Gain, It’s About What You LET GO
37:15 - The Principle of Tithing is Only for People Who Consider God First in Their Life

53:56 - Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 19
01:21:09 - The Tithe Must be First
01:24:04 - Genesis Chapter 4 Verses 3 through 5
01:26:55 - Exodus Chapter 13 Verses 14 & 15

itunes.summary:
In the fourth week of our series Paper Chasers, we heard a powerful message entitled “First AIN’T Second!” We learned that the Principle of Tithing is only for people who consider God first in their lives. Pastor Michael showed us a practical example of the First Fruits that revealed to us how much God blesses us when we truly put Him first. Is God first in your life? Check out this message and share it with a friend!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

items.title: Where The Money Resides // What Is The Soil Of Your Heart? // Paper Chasers // Michael Todd

items.content:
In the first week of our new series, Paper Chasers we were posed with the question, “Are You Chasing Paper?” Despite what the world tries to tell us, money is not the answer to our problems; God is always the answer to our problems! We learned that we are either a Paper Chaser or a Purpose Chaser. Which one are you? Make sure and check out this message and share it with a friend!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

If you would like to support TC financially you can give through the TC app, or online through our website by clicking here https://transformchurch.us/give/. Text ‘GIVE’ to 828282 to give using your mobile device.

If you need prayer, email prayer@transformchurch.us!

For more information about Transformation Church, visit transformchurch.us or follow us on our social media platforms below.

items.title: Distractions In The Deep // Are You Distracted? // Anchored // Michael Todd

items.content:
Today we continued in our series, Anchored. We heard about many powerful stories of Paul, who went through many storms and still remained Anchored in God. 2021 is the year of the ANTI-DRIFT and today we learned how to avoid getting carried away by the enemies schemes and lies. If you want to be Anchored in God this year, this message is for you! We encourage you to share this message with your friends and family!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and on Monday’s for Monday Night Prayer at 6pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 828282.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

If you would like to support TC financially you can give through the TC app, or online through our website by clicking here https://transformchurch.us/give/. Text ‘GIVE’ to 828282 to give using your mobile device.

If you need prayer, email prayer@transformchurch.us!

For more information about Transformation Church, visit transformchurch.us or follow us on our social media platforms below.

items.content:
Today we continued in our brand new series, Anchored. Being truly anchored to Jesus is crucial in our relationship with him. What we are anchored to directly affects every aspect of our lives. What are you anchored to this year? Are you dropping your anchor in the kiddie pool or the deep waters? Check out and share this week's message with a friend!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and weekly for NoonDay Prayer at 12pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 918-992-7623.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

If you would like to support TC financially you can give through the TC app, or online through our website by clicking here https://transformchurch.us/give/. Text ‘TCGIVE’ to 77977 to give using your mobile device.

If you need prayer, email prayer@transformchurch.us!

For more information about Transformation Church, visit transformchurch.us or follow us on our social media platforms below.

An Anchor That Holds?

Today we started our brand new series, Anchored. We learned about the many ways that God speaks to us. God Still Speaks // How does God Speak To Us? // Anchored // Michael Todd
An Anchor That Holds?

Today we started our brand new series, Anchored. We learned about the many ways that God speaks to us. If you are waiting on a word from God or if you need confirmation on a word that God has spoken to you, this message is for you! Make sure you are joining us in 21 Days of Prayer and Fasting. For more information, check out our social media platforms and our website!


Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and weekly for NoonDay Prayer at 12pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 918-992-7623.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

items.content:
Today we continued in our new series called, “FU” or “Forgiveness University.” Online classes are now in session and we are ready to learn about forgiveness. We learned that Crazy Faith is UNLOCKED in many different ways, if you are struggling to believe what God said will come to pass; this message is for you.

items.title: CRAZY Faith Unlocked  / Do You Have Crazy Faith? / Forgiveness University (Part 11) Michael Todd

items.content:
Today we continued in our new series called, “FU” or “Forgiveness University.” Online classes are now in session and we are ready to learn about forgiveness. In the tenth week of this series, we learned that releasing the debt that other people have done to us releases US and OUR FUTURE! Who do you need to forgive? If you are struggling with unforgiveness, check out this week's message as well as weeks 1-9 on practical and helpful tools to help you live in freedom!


Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and weekly for NoonDay Prayer at 12pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 918-992-7623.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

items.content:
Today we continued in our new series called, “FU” or “Forgiveness University.” Online classes are now in session and we are ready to learn about forgiveness. In the ninth week of this series, we had a special guest, Author Lysa TerKeurst. She shared her own personal story of forgiveness and used practical examples to help us all do the same. If you are struggling with forgiving what feels “unforgivable” this message is for you!

Join us for service every Sunday at 11am (CST) and weekly for NoonDay Prayer at 12pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 918-992-7623.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Tell us your story by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

items.content:
Today we continued in our new series called, “FU” or “Forgiveness University.” Online classes are now in session and we are ready to learn about forgiveness. In the eighth week of this series, Pastor Michael illustrated so powerfully about the impact of a Father who is Unaware. items.title: Forgiveness Understood // The Forgiveness Process // FU Forgiveness University (Part 4) Michael Todd

items.content: Today we continued in our new series called, “FU” or “Forgiveness University.” Online classes are now in session and we are ready to learn about forgiveness. In the third week of this series, Pastor Michael taught us that we can’t give what we don’t have. If you are struggling with forgiving someone, it is because you have not fully received the forgiveness that is freely given to you. Pastor Michael provides us with a Checklist  to help us forgive the wrongs that have been done to us. You don’t want to miss this message!

itunes.summary: Today we continued in our new series called, “FU” or “Forgiveness University.” Online classes are now in session and we are ready to learn about forgiveness. In the third week of this series, Pastor Michael taught us that we can’t give what we don’t have. If you are struggling with forgiving someone, it is because you have not fully received the forgiveness that is freely given to you. Pastor Michael provides us with a Checklist  to help us forgive the wrongs that have been done to us. You don’t want to miss this message!

items.content:
The Gift of Forgiveness // How to Forgive // FU - Forgiveness University (Part 1) Michael Todd

Description:

Today we started a brand new series called, “FU” or “Forgiveness University.” Online classes are now in session and we are ready to learn about forgiveness. This week, Pastor Michael spoke about the gift of forgiveness and the effects of offence. If you are having trouble letting go or if your past offences are continually weighing you down, this message is for you!

Join us for service online every Sunday at 11am (CST) and weekly for NoonDay Prayer at 12pm (CST).

If you received Christ through this message, text SAVED to 918-992-7623.

We would love to hear how God is touching your life through this ministry! Share your story with us by emailing mystory@transformchurch.us!

If you would like to support TC financially you can give through the TC app, or online through our website by clicking here https://transformchurch.us/give/. Text ‘TCGIVE’ to 77977 to give using your mobile device.

If you need prayer, email prayer@transformchurch.us!

For more information about Transformation Church, visit transformchurch.us or follow us on our social media platforms below.

Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/wearetransformation/?hl=en
Facebook- https://www.facebook.com/wearetransformation/

items.title: Upset The World // How to Identify Upsetters (Part 2) Tim Ross

items.content:
Today we started a brand new series entitled, “Upset The World” with our Oversight Pastor Tim Ross! Aside from being the oversight pastor of Transformation Church, he is the lead pastor of the multi-ethnic, multi-generational Embassy City Church in Irving, TX. His dynamic teaching style and uncanny ability to make people understand the gospel message is the reason why he has been such an asset to ministries across cultural and denominational lines. Pastor Tim is happily married to Juliette, and they have two sons.

In Part 1 of Upset The World, we learned that we might need to let go of some things, even our religion, in order to truly Upset the World. Check out this message now to see what we are talking about!

Pastor Craig Groeschel



Do you constantly feel burned out and exhausted by the pressure of comparison? Today we learned from Pastor Craig that we can’t faithfully follow Jesus if we are always comparing ourselves to others. If you struggle with comparing yourself to others, this message is for you!

Pastor Robert Madu spoke today about the seasons of breaking and how they are not meant to break you, but instead prepare you for the MORE God has for you! “How many loaves do you have?” Don’t know what we are talking about? Listen to this message to find out!
